intro: Quercus afares var. incana, commonly known as the silky oak, is a variant of the silky oak tree native to Australia. It is characterized by its silvery-white undersides on the leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a serrated margin and a hairy texture. The tree produces acorns, which are an important food source for various wildlife species.
